item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 19, 2025 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. TikTok goes dark in the US (882 points | 1462 comments)
2. When America's Top Spies Were Academics and Librarians (17 points | 7 comments)
3. Making glow-in-the-dark Strontium Aluminate (17 points | 5 comments)
4. Forgejo: A self-hosted lightweight software forge (215 points | 150 comments)
5. Haskell: A Great Procedural Language (130 points | 80 comments)
6. How hard would it be to display the contents of an image file on the screen? (52 points | 14 comments)
7. Alignment faking in large language models (22 points | 2 comments)
8. “The Traitors”, a reality TV show, offers a useful economics lesson (68 points | 45 comments)
9. GitHub introduces sub-issues, issue types and advanced search (170 points | 105 comments)
10. The "35-cent" Commodore 64 softmodem (75 points | 10 comments)
11. Rust: Investigating an Out of Memory Error (60 points | 19 comments)
12. VS Code Pets (430 points | 113 comments)
13. How Unix spell ran in 64kb RAM (173 points | 33 comments)
14. Yek: Serialize your code repo (or part of it) to feed into any LLM (104 points | 46 comments)
15. Show HN: Interactive systemd – a better way to work with systemd units (473 points | 179 comments)
16. Build a Database in 3000 Lines with 0 Dependencies (26 points | discuss)
17. Australian Open resorts to animated caricatures to bypass broadcast restrictions (185 points | 91 comments)
18. Hologram: A full-stack isomorphic Elixir web framework (90 points | 24 comments)
19. 'Once-in-a-century' discovery reveals luxury of Pompeii (84 points | 46 comments)
20. Open Dylan (13 points | discuss)
21. Volkswagen Sausage and the Enduring Appeal of Culinary Car-Industry Crossovers (6 points | 2 comments)
22. A System for the Sixties-and-a-Half: The Toshiba Visicom COM-100 (5 points | discuss)
23. Reverse Engineering a VanMoof E-Shifter – Part 2 – Decoding the Signals (25 points | 8 comments)
24. Why do bees die when they sting you? (2021) (302 points | 217 comments)
25. Generating an infinite world with the Wave Function Collapse algorithm (242 points | 64 comments)
26. We need to protect the protocol that runs Bluesky (68 points | 93 comments)
27. About A comprehensive guide for Linux Network (Socket) programming (3 points | 1 comment)
28. Boosting Computational Fluid Dynamics Performance with AMD MI300X (33 points | 14 comments)
29. Tracing Military Command Chains Through Time and Location (68 points | 10 comments)
30. The Fuzzing Book (3 points | discuss)
